events.name: Key components and critical materials in lithium-ion batteries
events.wd_label: Key components and critical materials in lithium-ion batteries
events.wd_description: Lithium-ion batteries are essential for mobile and stationary energy storage applications. The current technology relies on several critical materials, such as lithium, cobalt, nickel, manganese, and graphite, which are associated with various environmental and social impacts in their supply chain.
events.description: Lithium-ion batteries are essential for mobile and stationary energy storage applications. The current technology relies on several critical materials, such as lithium, cobalt, nickel, manganese, and graphite, which are associated with various environmental and social impacts in their supply chain.

events.name: Lithium
events.wd_description: Lithium is one of the critical materials used in lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: Lithium is one of the critical materials used in lithium-ion batteries.

events.name: Cobalt
events.wd_description: Cobalt is another critical material used in lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: Cobalt is another critical material used in lithium-ion batteries.

events.name: Nickel
events.wd_description: Nickel is also a critical material used in lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: Nickel is also a critical material used in lithium-ion batteries.

events.name: Manganese
events.wd_description: Manganese is one of the critical materials used in lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: Manganese is one of the critical materials used in lithium-ion batteries.

events.name: Graphite
events.wd_description: Graphite is another critical material used in lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: Graphite is another critical material used in lithium-ion batteries.

events.name: Assessment of social sustainability hotspots in lithium-ion batteries
events.wd_label: Assessment of social sustainability hotspots in lithium-ion batteries
events.wd_description: An assessment of the social sustainability hotspots of lithium-ion batteries is conducted, focusing on social risks such as child labor, corruption, occupational toxics and hazards, and poverty. This assessment is based on a spatially differentiated resource flow model of the supply chain using data from the Social Hotspots Database in openLCA.
events.description: An assessment of the social sustainability hotspots of lithium-ion batteries is conducted, focusing on social risks such as child labor, corruption, occupational toxics and hazards, and poverty. This assessment is based on a spatially differentiated resource flow model of the supply chain using data from the Social Hotspots Database in openLCA.

events.name: Child labor
events.wd_description: The assessment examines the risk of child labor in the supply chain of lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: The assessment examines the risk of child labor in the supply chain of lithium-ion batteries.

events.name: Corruption
events.wd_description: The assessment examines the risk of corruption in the supply chain of lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: The assessment examines the risk of corruption in the supply chain of lithium-ion batteries.

events.name: Occupational toxics and hazards
events.wd_description: The assessment examines the risk of occupational toxics and hazards in the supply chain of lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: The assessment examines the risk of occupational toxics and hazards in the supply chain of lithium-ion batteries.

events.name: Poverty
events.wd_description: The assessment examines the risk of poverty in the supply chain of lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: The assessment examines the risk of poverty in the supply chain of lithium-ion batteries.

events.name: Overview of lithium-ion battery supply chain
events.wd_label: Overview of lithium-ion battery supply chain
events.wd_description: The supply chain of lithium-ion batteries, including related production activities and material flows, is presented. Raw materials such as lithium, cobalt, nickel, manganese, and graphite are sourced from different locations and used as inputs for the production of intermediates and final battery cells.
events.description: The supply chain of lithium-ion batteries, including related production activities and material flows, is presented. Raw materials such as lithium, cobalt, nickel, manganese, and graphite are sourced from different locations and used as inputs for the production of intermediates and final battery cells.

events.name: Lithium
events.wd_description: Lithium is extracted mainly from Australia, Chile, and Argentina for use in lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: Lithium is extracted mainly from Australia, Chile, and Argentina for use in lithium-ion batteries.

events.name: Cobalt
events.wd_description: Cobalt is primarily produced in DR Congo, with minor production in Russia and Australia.
events.description: Cobalt is primarily produced in DR Congo, with minor production in Russia and Australia.

events.name: Nickel
events.wd_description: Nickel production is diversified geographically, with top producers including Indonesia, the Philippines, and Canada.
events.description: Nickel production is diversified geographically, with top producers including Indonesia, the Philippines, and Canada.

events.name: Manganese
events.wd_description: Manganese production mainly occurs in South Africa, China, and Australia.
events.description: Manganese production mainly occurs in South Africa, China, and Australia.

events.name: Graphite
events.wd_description: Graphite production is concentrated in China, with minor shares in India and Brazil.
events.description: Graphite production is concentrated in China, with minor shares in India and Brazil.

events.name: Intermediate production
events.wd_description: Raw materials are used to produce intermediates such as lithium-cobalt-nickel-manganese oxide and lithium hexafluorophosphate, mainly by specialty chemicals companies in China.
events.description: Raw materials are used to produce intermediates such as lithium-cobalt-nickel-manganese oxide and lithium hexafluorophosphate, mainly by specialty chemicals companies in China.

events.name: Final battery cell production
events.wd_description: The production of battery cells involves electrode production, cell assembly, formation, and aging, with major production capacities in China, Japan, South Korea, the United States, Sweden, and Poland.
events.description: The production of battery cells involves electrode production, cell assembly, formation, and aging, with major production capacities in China, Japan, South Korea, the United States, Sweden, and Poland.

events.name: S-LCA methodology and social impact assessment
events.wd_label: S-LCA methodology and social impact assessment
events.wd_description: Social Life Cycle Assessment (S-LCA) is a methodology to analyze the potential positive and negative social impacts of products along their life cycle. S-LCA provides complementary information to Environmental Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) by focusing on socio-economic interactions and the organizational and societal context of activities in the supply chain.
events.description: Social Life Cycle Assessment (S-LCA) is a methodology to analyze the potential positive and negative social impacts of products along their life cycle. S-LCA provides complementary information to Environmental Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) by focusing on socio-economic interactions and the organizational and societal context of activities in the supply chain.

events.name: S-LCA methodology
events.wd_description: S-LCA analyzes potential social impacts of products along their life cycle, similar to environmental LCA but with a focus on socio-economic aspects.
events.description: S-LCA analyzes potential social impacts of products along their life cycle, similar to environmental LCA but with a focus on socio-economic aspects.

events.name: Social impacts
events.wd_description: S-LCA assesses the potential positive and negative social impacts of products.
events.description: S-LCA assesses the potential positive and negative social impacts of products.

events.name: Socio-economic interactions
events.wd_description: S-LCA focuses on the socio-economic interactions of activities in the product supply chain.
events.description: S-LCA focuses on the socio-economic interactions of activities in the product supply chain.

events.name: Organizational and societal context
events.wd_description: S-LCA analyzes the organizational and societal context of activities in the supply chain.
events.description: S-LCA analyzes the organizational and societal context of activities in the supply chain.

events.name: Importance of site-specific data in S-LCA
events.wd_label: Importance of site-specific data in S-LCA
events.wd_description: Social impacts depend on the specific context of the product's supply chain, requiring the collection of site-specific data. Social hotspots are defined as activities in regions where social risks or opportunities exist.
events.description: Social impacts depend on the specific context of the product's supply chain, requiring the collection of site-specific data. Social hotspots are defined as activities in regions where social risks or opportunities exist.

events.name: Site-specific data
events.wd_description: S-LCA requires the collection of site-specific data to accurately assess social impacts.
events.description: S-LCA requires the collection of site-specific data to accurately assess social impacts.

events.name: Social hotspots
events.wd_description: Social hotspots are activities in regions where social risks or opportunities are present.
events.description: Social hotspots are activities in regions where social risks or opportunities are present.

events.name: Social Hotspots Database (SHDB) and its role in S-LCA
events.wd_label: Social Hotspots Database (SHDB) and its role in S-LCA
events.wd_description: The Social Hotspots Database (SHDB) provides access to social risk and opportunity information, helping to calculate and summarize the social performance of products across their supply chain and life cycle.
events.description: The Social Hotspots Database (SHDB) provides access to social risk and opportunity information, helping to calculate and summarize the social performance of products across their supply chain and life cycle.

events.name: SHDB
events.wd_description: The Social Hotspots Database provides access to social risk and opportunity information.
events.description: The Social Hotspots Database provides access to social risk and opportunity information.

events.name: Social risk information
events.wd_description: SHDB provides information on social risks across the product supply chain.
events.description: SHDB provides information on social risks across the product supply chain.

events.name: Social opportunity information
events.wd_description: SHDB provides information on social opportunities across the product supply chain.
events.description: SHDB provides information on social opportunities across the product supply chain.

events.name: Multi-regional input-output model
events.wd_description: SHDB uses a multi-regional input-output model based on the Global Trade Analysis Project to provide detailed social performance assessments.
events.description: SHDB uses a multi-regional input-output model based on the Global Trade Analysis Project to provide detailed social performance assessments.

events.name: Environmental and economic considerations
events.description: This includes the broader context of how social hotspots intersect with environmental and economic aspects, providing a holistic view of sustainability impacts.

events.name: Raw material locations
events.description: This refers to the geographical locations where raw materials used in lithium-ion batteries (such as lithium, cobalt, nickel, manganese, graphite) are sourced. It highlights the global distribution and production concentrations of these critical materials.

events.name: Electrode production
events.description: Cell assembly, formation, and aging are the key processes involved in the production of battery cells. Electrode production involves creating the anode and cathode, cell assembly is the construction of the battery cell, formation is the initial charge and discharge cycle, and aging refers to the stabilization process.
